intro: Psychotria flagelliflora, commonly known as the whip-flowered psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Psychotria flagelliflora is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
